verb.description: Give or order the giving of (something) as an official payment, compensation, or prize to (someone)
examples: he was awarded the Purple Heart
the 3.5 percent pay raise was awarded to the staff

noun.description: A prize or other mark of recognition given in honor of an achievement.
examples: the company's annual award for high-quality service

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense issue a judicial decision, also denoting the decision itself): from Anglo-Norman French awarder, variant of Old French esguarder consider, ordain, from es- (from Latin ex thoroughly) + guarder watch (over), based on a word of Germanic origin related to ward; compare with guard.
